00008 TRootanaDisplay::TRootanaDisplay() 
00009 {
00010   fNumberSkipEventsOnline = 1; 
00011   fNumberProcessed = 0;
00012   fCachedDataContainer = 0;
00013   SetDisplayName("Rootana Display");
00014 
00015   // Don't create second main window.
00016   DisableAutoMainWindow();
00017 
00018   // Don't create output ROOT files;
00019   // Output ROOT files will kill histograms.
00020   DisableRootOutput(true);
00021 
00022 }

00024 TRootanaDisplay::~TRootanaDisplay() {
00025 
00026   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++)
00027     delete fCanvasHandlers[i].second;
00028 
00029 };

00031 void TRootanaDisplay::InitializeMainWindow(){
00032 
00033   fMainWindow = new TMainDisplayWindow(gClient->GetRoot(),1200,800,IsOffline()); 
00034   
00035   // Link the a bunch of buttons in TMainWindowDisplay to functions in TRootanaDisplay.
00036   // This bit of ROOT magic requires that the TRootanaDisplay class get rootcint-ed.
00037   // It also requires that TRootanaDisplay methods be public (protected doesn't work).
00038 
00039   // The reset button
00040   fMainWindow->GetResetButton()->Connect("Clicked()", "TRootanaDisplay", this, "Reset()");
00041 
00042   // The tab buttons
00043   fMainWindow->GetTab()->Connect("Selected(Int_t)", "TRootanaDisplay", this, "UpdatePlotsAction()");
00044 
00045 
00046   // The next button
00047   if(IsOffline())
00048     fMainWindow->GetNextButton()->Connect("Clicked()", "TRootanaDisplay", this, "NextButtonPushed()");
00049 
00050   // The event skip counter
00051   if(IsOnline()){
00052     TGNumberEntry *skipButton = fMainWindow->GetSkipEventButton();
00053     skipButton->Connect("ValueSet(Long_t)", "TRootanaDisplay",this, "EventSkipButtonPushed()");
00054     skipButton->GetNumberEntry()->Connect("ReturnPressed()", "TRootanaDisplay", this, "EventSkipButtonPushed()");
00055     fNumberSkipEventsOnline = skipButton->GetNumberEntry()->GetIntNumber();    
00056   }
00057 
00058   // Let the user add all the canvases they want.
00059   AddAllCanvases();
00060 
00061   // Now map out window.
00062   GetDisplayWindow()->BuildWindow();
00063 }

00066 void TRootanaDisplay::AddSingleCanvas(TCanvasHandleBase* handleClass){
00067   
00068   GetDisplayWindow()->AddCanvas(handleClass->GetTabName());
00069   int tab_index = GetDisplayWindow()->GetTab()->GetNumberOfTabs() - 1;
00070   fCanvasHandlers.push_back(std::pair<int,TCanvasHandleBase*>(tab_index,handleClass));
00071 
00072   // Now set up the embedded canvas, if user so desires.
00073   TGCompositeFrame* embed = GetDisplayWindow()->GetTab()->GetTabContainer(tab_index);
00074   handleClass->SetUpCompositeFrame(embed,this);
00075  
00076 
00077 }

00079 
00080 bool TRootanaDisplay::ProcessMidasEvent(TDataContainer& dataContainer){
00081 
00082   fNumberProcessed++;
00083 
00084   // Only update histograms if we are "offline" or "online and but paused".
00085   // This ensures that we don't update if the user pressed 'pause' since the 
00086   // last event.
00087   if(!IsOnline() || (IsOnline() && !fMainWindow->IsDisplayPaused())){
00088     SetCachedDataContainer(dataContainer);
00089     
00090     // Perform any histogram updating from user code.
00091     UpdateHistograms(*fCachedDataContainer);
00092     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++)
00093       fCanvasHandlers[i].second->UpdateCanvasHistograms(*fCachedDataContainer);
00094   }  
00095 
00096   // If processing online and if processing is not paused, then just plot and return
00097   if(IsOnline() && !fMainWindow->IsDisplayPaused() ){
00098        
00099     // Do canvas plotting from user code; 
00100     // only do plot if we have processed enough events
00101     if(fNumberSkipEventsOnline == 1 || fNumberProcessed % fNumberSkipEventsOnline  == 1){      
00102       UpdatePlotsAction();
00103     }
00104     
00105     return true;
00106   }
00107 
00108   UpdatePlotsAction();
00109 
00110   // If offline, then keep looping till the next event button is pushed.
00111   // If online, then keep looping till the resume button is pushed.
00112   waitingForNextButton = true;
00113   while(1){
00114     
00115     // This is crude! Need to add some sort of wait function, otherwise 
00116     // this will use 99% of CPU time, for no good reason...
00117     // usleep(1000); this seems to work fine, but need to test a bit more first...
00118 
00119     // ROOT signal/slot trick; this variable will magically 
00120     // get changed to false once the next button is pushed.
00121     if(!waitingForNextButton){
00122       break;
00123     }
00124 
00125     // Alternately, break out if in online mode and 
00126     // no longer in paused state.  Again, the state of variable
00127     // will be changed by ROOT signal/slot callback.
00128     if(IsOnline() && !fMainWindow->IsDisplayPaused()){
00129       break;
00130     }
00131       
00132     // Resize windows, if needed.
00133     fMainWindow->ResetSize();
00134 
00135     // handle GUI events
00136     bool result = gSystem->ProcessEvents(); 
00137 
00138   }
00139 
00140   return true;
00141 
00142 }
00143 
00144 void TRootanaDisplay::BeginRun(int transition,int run,int time){
00145   
00146   std::cout << "Begin of run " << run << " at time " << time << std::endl;
00147   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++)    
00148     fCanvasHandlers[i].second->BeginRun(transition,run,time);
00149   UpdatePlotsAction();
00150 }
00151 
00152 void TRootanaDisplay::EndRun(int transition,int run,int time){
00153 
00154   std::cout << "End of run " << run << " at time " << time << std::endl;
00155   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++)
00156     fCanvasHandlers[i].second->EndRun(transition,run,time);
00157   UpdatePlotsAction();
00158 
00159 }

00162 
00163 void TRootanaDisplay::UpdatePlotsAction(){
00164 
00165   if(!fCachedDataContainer){
00166     char displayTitle[200];
00167     sprintf(displayTitle,"%s (): run %i (no events yet)",
00168             GetDisplayName().c_str(),GetCurrentRunNumber());
00169     GetDisplayWindow()->GetMain()->SetWindowName(displayTitle);
00170     return;
00171   }
00172     
00173   // Execute the plotting actions from user event loop.
00174   PlotCanvas(*fCachedDataContainer);
00175   
00176   // See if we find a user class that describes this tab.
00177   int currentTab = GetDisplayWindow()->GetCurrentTabNumber();
00178   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++){
00179     if(currentTab == fCanvasHandlers[i].first){
00180       TRootEmbeddedCanvas* embed = GetDisplayWindow()->GetEmbeddedCanvas(currentTab);
00181       fCanvasHandlers[i].second->PlotCanvas(*fCachedDataContainer,embed);
00182     }
00183   }
00184     
00185   
00186   // Set the display title
00187   char displayTitle[200];
00188   if(IsOnline())
00189     sprintf(displayTitle,"%s (online): run %i event %i",
00190             GetDisplayName().c_str(),GetCurrentRunNumber(),
00191             fCachedDataContainer->GetMidasData().GetSerialNumber());
00192   else
00193     sprintf(displayTitle,"%s (offline): run %i event %i",
00194             GetDisplayName().c_str(),GetCurrentRunNumber(),
00195             fCachedDataContainer->GetMidasData().GetSerialNumber());
00196     
00197   GetDisplayWindow()->GetMain()->SetWindowName(displayTitle);
00198 
00199 
00200   // Update canvas and window sizes    
00201   fMainWindow->ResetSize();
00202 }
00203 
00204 void TRootanaDisplay::Reset(){
00205   // Call the reset functions defined in user event loop.
00206   ResetHistograms();
00207   // Call the user defined canvas classes.
00208   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < fCanvasHandlers.size(); i++)
00209       fCanvasHandlers[i].second->ResetCanvasHistograms();
00210   UpdatePlotsAction();
00211 }
